intro: Comolia villosa var. glabrior, commonly known as the silky comolia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or red, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for garden cultivation in temperate climates.
